title: Contributing to bribeR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("jessietrudeau/BribeR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Corpus Overview
text: September 2000, series secretly recorded videos surfaced Peru showing Vladimiro Montesinos — head National Intelligence Service (SIN) President Alberto Fujimori — bribing, coercing, negotiating politicians, military officials, judges, media executives, businesspeople. recordings, widely known Vladivideos, exposed systematic corruption heart Fujimori regime ultimately led collapse government. Vladivideos corpus represents one extensive documented records institutional corruption Latin American history. transcripts capture conversations spanning topics election manipulation media control military promotions judicial interference. {BribeR} packages curated standardized version corpus, making accessible reproducible political science, network analysis, text-based research.

title: Corpus Overview
text: transcripts follow turn-based structure row represents single speech turn. standardized format supports direct use tidyverse workflows:
code: # Example: who speaks the most in transcript 6? read_transcripts(transcripts = 6) |>   filter(speaker_std != "BACKGROUND") |>   count(speaker_std, sort = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   speaker_std     n #>   <chr>       <int> #> 1 MONTESINOS    442 #> 2 RICKETTS      428 # Example: how many words per speaker in transcript 6? read_transcripts(transcripts = 6) |>   filter(speaker_std != "BACKGROUND") |>   mutate(word_count = stringr::str_count(speech, "\\S+")) |>   group_by(speaker_std) |>   summarise(total_words = sum(word_count, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |>   arrange(desc(total_words)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   speaker_std total_words #>   <chr>             <int> #> 1 MONTESINOS         9701 #> 2 RICKETTS           3105

text: tibble one row per transcript columns: n (character): transcript identifier. date (character): date associated transcript (NA absent). speakers (list character): unique, sorted vector speakers transcript. n_words (integer): total word count across transcript's speech column. topics (list character): vector topic names inferred topic_* flags.

title: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
text: Transcript ID (n) date: Read bundled descriptions dataset. Topics (topics list-column): Columns descriptions whose names start topic_ interpreted topic flags. topic considered present cell "truthy" (e.g., x/X, non-empty string, 1, TRUE). Topic names normalized removing topic_ prefix replacing _ spaces. Speakers (speakers list-column): Read bundled speakers_per_transcript dataset. Speaker columns collapsed unique, sorted character vector per transcript. Duration (n_words): Computed bundled vladivideos_detailed dataset summing whitespace-delimited tokens speech column unique transcript n.
